name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Spokane City Center

reviews.title: Great location - dated property with weird elevators / floorplan
reviews.text: Just looking at the picture of this property, you can sense the difficulties of navigating it. A hotel with wings, like a spoke around a wheel (appropriate for SPOK-ane? eh? eh?) means long back-and-forths to get to the parking area, etc.
Also, there isn't just one elevator shaft -- so, if you call the elevator, it may open in a place not exactly where you are standing. Kind of weird, but, all live-able details.
reviews.title: Great Stay In Spokane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, the location is perfect -- especially if you are driving to work, but want to be able to walk around downtown.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Spokane
Spokane Double Tree
reviews.text: Complimentary and courteous airport shuttle service ideal. Short ride during non peak traffic hours to hotel. Check in welcoming, warm cookie great, rooms clean and hotel well situated in town. The hotel is by the convention center so that makes it super convenient for any business/trade events going on. Every staff person that I interacted with was very friendly and well versed on service. I normally stay at the airport but this trip I needed to be downtown for other reasons - but I will be sure to book this property again based on convenience, value and hospitality.

We stayed here for just one night to attend a wedding in town. Our stay was very enjoyable. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. In fact, the bed was exceptionally comfortable and we had a great nights sleep.
reviews.title: Grandma called, she wants her bathroom back!! circa 1964

reviews.text: The staff were all very nice and helpful. The river is just a few steps away with a beautiful trail to take a stroll. Our rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. We had breakfast at the buffet every morning, plenty of choices. We'll be staying there when we go to Spokane again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: I prefer Hilton Hotels and usually search Hilton first. We arrived via Amtrak in the very early morning and this Hotel was about 4 blocks from the Train station.Walked over right to the front entrance.The front desk let us check in early after 5A.M. Could not have been nicer. Great location,walking distance to everything in the downtown area. Breakfast was very good for 9$/person. Shuttle service to airport very nice. Would certainly stay again without question.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very happy with the room overall, nicely furnished, clean and spacious. We were especially happy with the bed, it was very comfortable! The room was very quiet and we didn't hear hallway noise. Very nice overall, would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Hotel room was dirty and uncomfortable. Other peoples hair in bathroom, moldy peeling tile/wallpaper, with moldy smell. It was disappointing trial, as I went with my better judgment to stick with my normal family stays for hotels. I thought it would be nice to walk downtown from the hotel with it being so central. We stayed a 2nd night elsewhere. Do not recommend to my family/friends.
reviews.title: Family Stay on September 7th

reviews.text: Hotel is conveniently located adjacent to the Convention Center and Riverfront Park. Excellent location within easy walking distance to numerous restaurants downtown. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and received an excellent value for the money.
reviews.title: Doubletree by Hilton Spokane

reviews.text: We took our bikes for a romantic weekend and the close proximity to Centennial Trail and downtown mafe the Doubletree a good hotel for us. It was clean cozy and cool during the warm night. I wish the tub was bigger for deeper soaking after a long ride but I still got the chance to get some rest and relaxation. I would come bsck again.
reviews.title: Good value and great location

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay but the air conditioner in the room was very noisy. The bathroom is small and needs updating. Room still has popcorn celings. But still a good stay. Bed was comfortable and view was terrific. Restaurant was excellent. Thanks
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Although the location is very good, I feltthe room was substandard. Very outdated bathroom with 30 year old Laminate countertops, and tile. The room was also very small. I have stayed at many other Hilton properties, and this one is my least favorite. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member, and felt like the flloors designated for this category should be better appointed.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Rooms were clean, service was good, people were really nice. I would recommend it to anyone. Several good restaurants and places to shop within walking distance as well as walking distance from a really nice park . I like that they are also close to the Theatre for Performing Arts. With budgets becoming smaller and smaller it's a shame we have to pay to park there.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: Three of us had just finished a 5-day bike trip -- exhausted and with dirty bikes. The hotel staff was wonderful in accommodating our bikes. We selected this hotel because it was such close walking distance to great restaurants like Mizuna and had a brief, but great stay.
reviews.title: Great location and service
Convenient
reviews.text: Room comfort was excellent, speedy check in and check out. Close to everything down town, no need to drive. Valet services were excellent, friendly. My daughter and I stayed there for a concert at the INB performance center. We just walked everywhere. We will definitely stay there next time we go to Spokane.

Had a 2 nite stay for business here last week. Altho it's 8mi to the airport, they offer a free shuttle. I arrived about 10:15am, arrived at the hotel shortly there after and was given a cookie and my room right away. Pool was very nice altho the hot tubl jets didn't seem to fully work. Great trails along the river right behind the hotel to take to the park or to Gonzaga. The next day downtown meeting very walkable. Fitness room adequate with free weights, medicine balls, treadmills, ellipticals. Bathrm small but adequate and nice Crabtree &Evelyn products. Bed very comfortable as well. Note location great to convention center and nice performing arts center where I caught a great concert last minute. Would definitely choose this hotel if I return to downtown Spokane. Staff also friendly. and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Spent a great weekend at this hotel which is ideally located in Spokane for Gonzaga and city center, you can walk to both! Rooms are getting a little old but are clean. We had a noisy air conditioning unit the first night but they handled it very well and moved us for the other nights. Great value and the breakfast is also.
reviews.title: Dropping of College kids!

reviews.text: I stayed here on a business overnight, and found it to be perfectly adequate. Everything you'd expect from a Hilton DoublTree was present here. Clean lobby, friendly staff, quite rooms, great views, and more. The only down side was the room was a bit small, but since the building was constructed decades ago, I understood that they had to make the best of what they had. I think they did a good job.
reviews.title: Better than most other options in Spokane
Awesome Service/ Great Bedding
reviews.text: We loved it here and I have another trip booked in October. The Pool and bedding were great ! My son is going to Gonzaga and I will be staying at this hotel only. Spencers Restaurant was great 5 star and so nice to be able to just walk down to an amazing Dinner.

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Hotel Spokane City
